Detailed Description

A pane-object is a graphical object which is part of the glass-pane and is drawn above all windows. Each pane-object has a bounding-rectangle and may have a renderer which is able to draw the content of any object. If no renderer is required, the drawing simply can be done by overwriting the method PaneObject::Draw.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Member Function Documentation

void PaneObject::Draw (  DeviceContext *  dc  )  [virtual]
 

If a renderer has been specified, it is triggered automatically which results in drawing the object to be rendered. If no renderer is needed, this method may be overwritten to draw the content of the pane-object.

Reimplemented in IndicatorPaneObject, and IndicatorBarPaneObject.

void PaneObject::Invalidate (   ) 
 

Results into an asynchronous redrawing of the pane-object. This method must be invoked each time the state of the pane-object has been changed.
